metadata.title: CVE-2019-15681 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
LibVNC commit before d01e1bb4246323ba6fcee3b82ef1faa9b1dac82a contains a memory leak (CWE-655) in VNC server code, which allow an attacker to read stack memory and can be abused for information disclosure. Combined with another vulnerability, it can be used to leak stack memory and bypass ASLR. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. These vulnerabilities have been fixed in commit d01e1bb4246323ba6fcee3b82ef1faa9b1dac82a. Pavel Cheremushkin discovered that TightVNC has a memory leak vulnerability. An attacker could use it to disclosure sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-15681` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.12+dfsg-8
libvncserver1 - 0.9.12+dfsg-8
No subscription required

vino - 3.22.0-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krfb package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
libvncserver package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.12+dfsg-8').
tightvnc package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
veyon package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
vino package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-6ubuntu1').
x11vnc package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
